programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.sub-title: India v Sri Lanka: Third T20I.
programme.desc: India v Sri Lanka. Coverage of the third and final match of the series, held at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. India have lost both matches they have played here in this format, suffering a six-wicket defeat against England in 2012 and a seven-wicket loss at the hands of the West Indies in 2016. Virat Kohli top-scored for the home side with 89 in that most recent match, but it was not enough to prevent a Windies victory

programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Houston Texans v Pittsburgh Steelers (Kick-off 9.30pm). Coverage of the match between the respective AFC South and AFC North sides, which takes place at NRG Stadium. Both of these sides qualified for the Wildcard round of the play-offs last season, with the Texans overcoming Oakland Raiders and the Steelers defeating Miami Dolphins. However, both teams would eventually fall to the eventual Super Bowl champions New England Patriots - the Texans lost in the Divisional round and the Steelers were defeated in the AFC Championship game(n)

Both of these sides qualified for the Wildcard round of the play-offs last season, with the Texans overcoming Oakland Raiders and the Steelers defeating Miami Dolphins. However, both teams would eventually fall to the eventual Super Bowl champions New England Patriots - the Texans lost in the Divisional round and the Steelers were defeated in the AFC Championship game(n)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: First inning: Segments on baseball's history prior to the 20th century include the game's origins; the nation's first organized teams; Albert Goodwill Spalding; and greats Cy Young, Cap Anson and King Kelly. John Chancellor is the narrator. (cc)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Second inning (1900-1910): The start of Ban Johnson's American League; the first World Series; the "Merkle boner"; the first leagues for women and blacks; profiles Honus Wagner, Ty Cobb, Walter Johnson. (cc)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Third inning (1910-20). A profile of Connie Mack; Ty Cobb's suspension; the construction of Ebbets Field; and the Black Sox scandal in the 1919 World Series. John Chancellor is the narrator. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Chronicling the powerful 1990s Indians teams that electrified the city of Cleveland, winning six of seven division titles only to fall short in two World Series trips. programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.sub-title: The Impossible Dream: Red Sox Nation Begins
programme.desc: Long before the likes of Big Papi, Pedro, Manny and even before the heartbreak of Buckner and the indelible image of Fisk waving the ball fair, Red Sox Nation as we know it began 50 years ago with the Impossible Dream of 1967. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: A 75-year retrospective on Hall of Famer Ted Williams' pursuit of the last .400 batting average. Comments from the Red Sox star are interspersed with those of Wade Boggs, George Brett, Rod Carew and the late Tony Gwynn, who all fell short of the feat. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: A 75th-anniversary look at Joe DiMaggio's famed 56-game hitting streak, featuring players who've fallen short of the record including Pete Rose, Paul Molitor and Jimmy Rollins, as well as college record-holder Robin Ventura (58 games). Ed Burns narrates. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: A look at the decades of personal stories of Cuban baseball players and their defection from their country in pursuit of a Major League career, from Tony Oliva and Luis Tiant to Aroldis Chapman and Yasiel Puig. Narrated by actor Bobby Cannavale. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.sub-title: Lenny Randle, "The Most Interesting Man in Baseball"
programme.desc: A look at the colorful life and 12-year MLB career of Lenny Randle, who discusses from his home in Italy why Rolling Stone dubbed him "the most interesting man in baseball." Narrated by comedian and Mets fan Jim Breuer. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Chronicling the bittersweet history of the Expos through reflections by former players, journalists, broadcasters and executives. Featured: Andre Dawson; Cliff Floyd; Rusty Staub; Pedro Martinez, Dave Van Horne, and Jonah Keri. William Shatner narrates. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.sub-title: Holy Cow! The Story of Harry Caray
programme.desc: A look at Hall of Fame broadcaster Harry Caray's rise to becoming an iconic voice in baseball, and how his legacy still resonates throughout the game today. Narrated by actor and Cubs fan William Petersen. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.sub-title: Against the Odds: The Mike Piazza Story
programme.desc: A look at Hall of Fame inductee Mike Piazza's improbable rise from a 62nd-round draft pick to baseball immortality. Footage of Piazza's orientation visit to Cooperstown accompanies stories from teammates and managers. Mets fan Matthew Broderick narrates. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Chronicling owner Charlie Finley's "Mustache Gang" Oakland A's dynasty of the early 1970s, which had players such as Rollie Fingers, Gene Tenace and Reggie Jackson leading the way to three straight titles. Narrated by MC Hammer, a former A's employee. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: A 25-year retrospective on fiery relief pitchers Norm Charlton, Randy Myers and Rob Dibble and the Reds' run to the 1990 World Series title. Included: Lou Piniella, Barry Larkin, Paul O'Neill, Marty Brennaman and ex-Cincinnati mayor Jerry Springer. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.sub-title: Jim Leyland: A Life in Baseball
programme.desc: Chronicling former Pirates, Marlins, Rockies and Tigers manager Jim Leyland, from his upbringing in Perrysburg, Ohio, to his lengthy coaching career. Tony LaRussa, Gene Lamont and Dave Dombrowski are among those interviewed. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Chronicling eccentric Detroit Tigers pitcher Mark Fidrych 40 years after his dazzling 1976 debut season, which introduced his unusual mound antics. Tom Selleck narrates alongside interviews with Fidrych's wife, daughter and former teammates. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of 2015 Hall of Fame inductee Randy Johnson, looking at his transformative journey from raw talent to dominant force. Narrated by Metallica lead singer and Rock and Roll Hall of Famer James Hetfield. (cc)

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Chronicling the colorful and complicated life of brilliant manager Billy Martin on the 40th anniversary of his 1977 World Series title with the Yankees. Interviews include Martin's son Billy Jr., widow Jill and ex-wife Gretchen. Narrator: John Turturro. (cc)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Fourth inning (1920-30). Babe Ruth; the start of the Negro National League; profiles of Rogers Hornsby, Lou Gehrig and the '27 Yankees' "Murderers' Row." John Chancellor is the narrator. (cc)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Fifth inning (1930-40). The Negro Leagues; Babe Ruth's "called shot" in the 1932 World Series; profiles of Bob Feller, Satchel Paige and Joe DiMaggio. John Chancellor narrates. (cc)

programme.title: Ken Burns' Baseball
programme.desc: Sixth inning (1940-50). The batting feats of Joe DiMaggio and Ted Williams; World War II and its effects on the game; the Rockford Peaches and the women's pro leagues; Branch Rickey signs Jackie Robinson, breaking the Major League color barrier; the death of Babe Ruth. John Chancellor narrates. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2011: Cardinals vs. Rangers
programme.desc: From 2011: St. Louis vs. Texas. Unheralded Cardinals 3B David Freese hit his way to MVP of a seven-game drama that sent manager Tony La Russa to retirement on top, while the Rangers and manager Ron Washington swallowed a second-straight Series defeat. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2012: Giants vs. Tigers
programme.desc: From 2012: San Francisco vs. Detroit. The Giants swept their way to a second championship in three years, holding Detroit to six runs in four games. MVP Pablo Sandoval and closer Sergio Romo were standouts. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2013: Cardinals vs. Red Sox
programme.desc: From 2013: St. Louis vs. Boston. The Red Sox captured their third championship in 10 years after overcoming St. Louis in six games. David Ortiz, Jon Lester, Koji Uehara and Matt Holliday were among the standout performers. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2014: Giants vs. Royals
programme.desc: From 2014: San Francisco vs. Kansas City. A pair of wild-card teams waged a seven-game Fall Classic, with MVP Madison Bumgarner carrying the Giants to their third title in five years. The Royals were 8-0 to start their first postseason since 1985. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2015: Royals vs. Mets
programme.desc: From 2015: Kansas City vs. New York Mets. In their second-straight World Series, Ned Yost's Royals ended a 30-year title drought by coming back in all four of their wins, using baserunning, defense and an airtight bullpen. Salvador Perez was named MVP. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Classic World Series Film: 2016: Cubs vs. Indians
programme.desc: From 2016: Cleveland vs. Chicago Cubs. Baseball's two longest-running title droughts collided in a storybook series won in seven games by Joe Maddon's Cubs, whose previous title was in 1908. Series MVP Ben Zobrist and Indians hurler Corey Kluber starred. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Chasing 3000
programme.desc: Fact-based story of two brothers who travel from Los Angeles to Pittsburgh in the hopes of witnessing Roberto Clemente's 3000th hit in 1972. Co-written and directed by Gregory J. Lanesey. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck minor-league baseball player stands to inherit 300 million dollars if he can spend one million dollars a day for thirty days in a row. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Bull Durham
programme.desc: A minor-league catcher and a baseball groupie team to help a talented young pitcher make it to the big leagues, and fall in love in the process. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Field of Dreams Twenty-Five Years Later
programme.desc: Kevin Costner heads a celebration of the 1989 baseball film "Field of Dreams," joining fellow actors Timothy Busfield and Dwier Brown in Dyersville, Iowa. Host: Bob Costas. (cc)(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30

programme.title: SportsCenter

programme.desc: Our Quebec-hosted hunt with preferred outfitter Jack Hume Adventures continues as hunt specialist David Sager looks for a caribou bull. Chris Auch gets a chance at his first-ever caribou. Then, we find Rob Dunham on a Mexico desert sheep hunt

programme.title: Moment of Impact
programme.desc: True Magnum hunt specialist David Sager and elite member Jim Gibson hunt caribou with Jack Hume Adventures. Then, Steve Brett hunts with Prairie King Outfitters in Nebraska and gets his biggest buck to date

programme.title: Moment of Impact
programme.desc: Hunt specialist Chris Auch continues his quest for a Newfoundland bull moose, but his hunt takes an unexpected turn. Then, we hop over to Quebec with James Brion and elite member Alex Arapaglou for a caribou double

programme.title: West of Texas
programme.desc: Hunting in the untouched wilderness of Canada's Northwest Territories, Stephen West and friend Gary Sitton are in a man-against-nature situation. The main focus of this hunt is a Dall sheep for Gary

programme.title: Bowhunter TV
programme.desc: Bowhunter publisher Jeff Waring's amazing Greenland adventure continues. This time, Outfitter Frank Feldmann takes the team into the steep, rocky hills in search of reclusive Greenlandic caribou bulls

programme.title: The Fierce Life
programme.desc: The Fierce Brass travel to Canada to hunt caribou

programme.title: Trijicon's World of Sports Afield
programme.desc: Zach Neher joins Chifuti PH Len Taylor for a classic 'Dangerous Double' in Zimbabwe. Both leopard and Nile crocodile are on tap, and both will test one's patience and determination before the issue is decided

programme.title: Hornady's Dark & Dangerous
programme.sub-title: Big Bulls by Land and Sea
programme.desc: We conclude this season with three separate hunts for dangerous game. On the menu we have two completely different hunts for cape buffalo, and will also be in pursuit of hippo on the mighty Zambezi River

programme.title: Razor Dobbs Alive
programme.desc: Razor Dobbs harvests his first-ever cape buffalo with a 10mm auto pistol

programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Jason joins his girlfriend Cassandra in central Montana for her very first mule deer hunt. After finding this world-class buck in September, the two are able to keep tabs on him in October after the general season opener

programme.title: Long Range Pursuit
programme.desc: Chad Fraughton ventures south of the border in pursuit of a desert bighorn. Sonora, Mexico is an experience not to be missed

programme.title: Spook Nation
programme.desc: As Spook's season comes to a close, he spends time chasing deer and ducks with Gary LeVox, while good friends Will Simmons and Ms. Mary chase giant bucks in Alberta

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven visits south Texas to trap wild hogs

programme.title: Winchester Deadly Passion
programme.desc: After putting in for 10-years, Melissa Bachman finally draws a rifle mule deer tag on the Kaibab in Arizona. This is a sought after tag and it doesn't take long before the big bucks start showing themselves

programme.title: The Most Wanted List
programme.desc: Country star Chase Rice tunes in on whitetail as he accompanies Kristy on a frozen Michigan hunt

programme.title: Wildlifers
programme.desc: The Wildlifers are back home at the Mellon Creek Ranch in Refugio, Texas, giving us a small glimpse of some of the abundant wildlife the ranch has to offer

programme.title: The Fierce Life
programme.desc: Part 2. The staff joins Yukon Big Game Outfitters in search of moose in the mighty Yukon Territory

programme.title: West of Texas
programme.desc: Stephen is guiding his dad in Mexico on a trophy mule deer hunt. After a tough week of hunting, they make a last-ditch effort on a wide Mexico giant

programme.title: Into High Country
programme.desc: Jason joins his girlfriend Cassandra in central Montana for her very first mule deer hunt. After finding this world-class buck in September, the two are able to keep tabs on him in October after the general season opener

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi Schmidt and Chris Nowak are off to Montana with their bows to chase elk, after a five-year break from not drawing a tag in the famed Missouri Breaks of Montana

programme.title: Sheep Shape
programme.desc: Chad Hall and friends keep pursuing Dall sheep, moose and caribou in the Northwest Territories

programme.title: The Western Hunter
programme.desc: Chris Denham hunts Sitka blacktail deer on Kodiak Island for the first time while Nate makes a return visit after an incredible trip the prior year

programme.title: Guns & Gear
programme.desc: Introducing Caracal's Enhanced F polymer pistol and its many features. Also: Springfield Armory's 1911 RO line, Ruger's 10/22 TD integrally-suppressed barrel, more Shields from Smith & Wesson and new Barnes Bullets VOR-TX and Precision Match ammo

programme.title: Darex Work Sharp
programme.desc: A knife sharpener designed to sharpen knives and tools, including scissors, axes, mower blades, garden shears and shovels

programme.title: GunVenture
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at The Reliant, and a first-hand look at how guns were incorporated from start to finish. Also: Chris Cerino dispels common movie and TV myths, and Ryan heads to a gun-training school for actors and stunt people

programme.title: Monster Bucks
programme.desc: David Blanton teases this year's DVD of Monster Bucks 25

programme.title: Fresh Tracks With Randy Newberg
programme.sub-title: A Sonoran Safari of Coues Deer, Javelina, Mearns Quail
programme.desc: Randy finally schedules a bucket list item: Coues whitetail, archery-style. Adding to the fun are javelina and Mearns' quail. Randy is joined by Wade Zarlingo, Jerry Pritchard and Larry Stickler

programme.title: Petersen's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: Part 3. Craig Boddington and Steve Hornady are on a bucket list safari in Uganda. Tag along as they hunt Nile buffalo, track plains game across the long-grass savanna and fish the headwaters of the mighty Nile

programme.title: Gallery of Guns
programme.desc: We have a colorful conceal-carry option with the Davidson's special edition Glock 42 in robin's egg blue. For a smaller option, try the North American Arms mini-revolver. Also: reviews of the Smith & Wesson M&P15 MOE and Mossberg MVP Long Range

programme.title: Bond Arms
programme.desc: Bond Arms, Special Edition. Old Glory Handgun

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor travel deep into the Everglades to catch tarpon from a paddle board

programme.title: The Gypsy Angler
programme.desc: Captain Ray Van Horn heads to Louisiana for large predatory fish in the pogey schools

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Captain Wild Bill from the Deadliest Catch joins Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger on a somewhat relaxed day in the gulf

programme.title: In-Fisherman
programme.desc: It's right up the staff's alley to cut through any complications on the way to fine fishing. They use live bait for snook; slip into two-timing mode to do battle with crappies, perch and largemouths on ice; and reveal spoon secrets for smallmouths

programme.title: The Outfitters
programme.sub-title: The Last Frontier - Ninilchik Outfiiters, AK Part 1
programme.desc: Part 1. Fred and Conway wrap up the season with a trip to Alaska. Salmon, halibut, rockfish and bear all come out to play as Ninilchik Outfitters give the guys a taste of the Last Frontier

programme.title: Hollywood Hunter
programme.sub-title: Pennsylvania Prize - The Buck Pool Is Back!
programme.desc: Every year, the Pennsylvania Buck Pool takes place with Freddy and friends at the Harteis Farm located in Halifax, Pa

programme.title: Brotherhood Outdoors
programme.desc: Hailing from Missouri, Jim Mesh is a proud member of the United Transportation Union. He shares the impact that the brotherhood has made on his life, then heads to Louisiana to reel in the prolific redfish

programme.title: Red Rising

programme.title: All Things Hunting - ATH

programme.desc: Few good days and many tough ones add up to another fun and interesting season for Mike and friends

programme.title: North American Whitetail Television
